meanings.definition: To wake or wake up again.
meanings.sent1: After a long nap, she was rewaking to start her day.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, the alarm clock rewakes him from his slumber.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept rewaking the whole household by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The sun rewaking the flowers in the garden with its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh coffee rewaking his senses as he entered the kitchen.

meanings.definition: The act of waking or waking up again.
meanings.sent1: His rewaking in the middle of the night was due to a loud noise outside.
meanings.sent2: The rewaking of the city at dawn signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent3: The rewaking of the computer system caused chaos in the office.
meanings.sent4: The rewaking of old memories brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent5: The rewaking of the bear from hibernation was a sight to behold in the forest.
